{{short description|Largest engagement between Estonians serving in the Red Army and Estonian pro-independence and Waffen-SS units.}} {{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of Porkuni |image= II maailmasõjas hukkunute matmispaik (Porkuni lahing).jpg |image_size= 275px |caption= |partof=[[World War II]] |place=[[Porkuni]], [[Viru County]], [[Estonia]] |coordinates = {{coord|59|10|40|N|26|09|37|E|display=title}} |date=September 21, 1944 |result=Soviet victory |combatant1=[[File:Estonian Division.jpg|20px]] [[20th Waffen Grenadier Division of the SS (1st Estonian)|Estonian conscripts]] |combatant2=[[File:Flag of the Soviet Union (1936-1955).svg|25px]] [[Soviet Union]] |commander1=[[File:Estonian Division.jpg|20px]] Juhan Vermet |commander2=[[File:Flag of the Soviet Union (1936-1955).svg|25px]] August Feldman |strength1=1,500 |strength2=10,000 |casualties1=500 dead,
700 captured{{cite web|url=http://www.postimees.ee/120904/esileht/siseuudised/144273.php|publisher=[[Postimees]]|language=Estonian|title=Porkuni vennatapulahing niitis eesti sõjamehi|date=11 September 2004|access-date=2009-06-14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090104093414/http://www.postimees.ee/120904/esileht/siseuudised/144273.php|archive-date=2009-01-04|url-status=dead|df=}} |casualties2=~1,000 | }} {{Campaignbox Estonia 1944}} '''Battle of Porkuni''' ({{lang-et|Porkuni lahing}}) was the largest engagement between [[Estonians]] serving in the [[Red Army]] and Estonian pro-independence and Waffen-SS units. It took place on 21 September 1944{{cite book |title=Soviet Estonia: Land, People, Culture |last=Naan |first=Gustav |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=1980 |publisher=Valgus Publishers |location= |isbn= |pages=104 |url=https://books.google.com/books?ei=CPwNSbvlBZysMpbxkZ4E&q=%22Battle+of+Porkuni%22&btnG=Search+Books }} between [[Lake Porkuni]] and the [[Sauvälja]] village about seven kilometres northeast of the town of [[Tamsalu]][http://www.maplandia.com/estonia/laane-viru/tamsalu/porkuni/] location of the lake during the [[Leningrad Front]]'s [[Tallinn Offensive Operation]] (17 September 1944 – 26 September 1944). The 249th Rifle Regiment of the [[8th Estonian Rifle Corps]] had heavy machine guns and mortars and were supported by [[artillery]] and [[tank]]s. Soldiers of the [[20th Waffen Grenadier Division of the SS (1st Estonian)|Estonian Waffen Grenadier Division]] had only light arms and antitank weapons in the form of German [[panzerfaust]]s. The 8th Rifle Corps surrounded about 1,500 Estonians retreating from the [[Battle of Tannenberg Line|Tannenberg line]] in the [[Sinimäed Hills]]. In the ensuing battle, more than 500 surrounded Estonians were killed. Around 700 were captured. Villagers buried 273 dead Estonians in German uniform. The Soviet Rifle Corps lost 73 men killed, of whom 57 had Estonian names.{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Porkuni 1944}} [[Category:Battles involving Estonia]] [[Category:Battles and operations of the Soviet–German War]] [[Category:Reichskommissariat Ostland]] [[Category:Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic]] [[Category:Tamsalu Parish]] [[Category:1944 in Estonia]] [[Category:September 1944 events]] {{WWII-battle-stub}} {{Estonia-hist-stub}}
